Container.Name: jellyfin_with_request
Container.Overview:
Jellyfin server and webui built off the latest commits. It includes several plugins by default and personal changes
This image comes with the following plugins pre-installed:
1. **Custom Tabs** by IAmParadox27 - Add custom tabs to your Jellyfin interface - Repository: https://github.com/IAmParadox27/jellyfin-plugin-custom-tabs - License: GPL-3.0
2. **File Transformation** by IAmParadox27 - Transform and manage files - Repository: https://github.com/IAmParadox27/jellyfin-plugin-file-transformation - License: GPL-3.0
3. **Jellyfin Enhanced** by n00bcodr - Enhanced Jellyfin features - Repository: https://github.com/n00bcodr/jellyfin-enhanced
## Automatic Backups
This image automatically creates backups of your database and configuration on: - First container start - Docker image updates
Backups are stored in `/config/backups/` and the last 10 backups are retained.
## License
This Docker image includes plugins licensed under GPL-3.0. See individual plugin repositories for detailed license information.

Config.Name: Https webUI
Config.Description: Optional - Https webUI (you need to set up your own certificate).

Config.Name: discover Jellyfin
Config.Description: Optional - Allows clients to discover Jellyfin on the local network.

Config.Name: DNLA
Config.Description: Optional - Service discovery used by DNLA and clients.

Config.Name: TV Shows
Config.Description: Media goes here. Add as many as needed e.g. `/data/movies`, `/data/tv`, etc.

Config.Name: Movies
Config.Description: Media goes here. Add as many as needed e.g. `/data/movies`, `/data/tv`, etc.

Config.Name: Appdata
Config.Description: Jellyfin data storage location. *This can grow very large, 50gb+ is likely for a large collection.*
